definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages

sentences.english: The bulk of the railroad workers voted to go back to work.
sentences.chinese: 大多數鐵路工人投票義馬市竊聽器同意規復事變。

sentences.english: He heard that they were planning to bug his office.
sentences.chinese: 他聽說他們正計劃在他的辦公室裏裝竊聽器。

sentences.english: All the bugs were spotted at their suitable positions.
sentences.chinese: 所有的竊聽器都安置到適當隱蔽的位置上了。
他們在美國大使館安裝竊聽器。

sentences.english: They put a tap on his telephone and recorded all his calls.
sentences.chinese: 他們在他的電話上裝上了竊聽器，錄下了所有通話。

sentences.english: The state-of-the-art receiver inside the nylon bag could now hear every word.
sentences.chinese: 尼龍包裏最頂級的竊聽器現在可以聽到每一個字。

sentences.english: The Hisense air-conditioning has infinity transmitter near its draft flue.
sentences.chinese: 我家的海信空調通風管附近私藏有竊聽器。

sentences.english: Used to be , if spies wanted to eavesdrop, they planted a bug.
sentences.chinese: 在以前，如果想要竊聽他人，需要安插一個竊聽器。
